title: The Ossians
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: The mountainous sides of Loch Broom loomed in the distance.

title: The Ossians
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: The houses were nestled in the only flat part on the banks of Loch Broom.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: From Buchanness Point to the Point of Ardnamurchan in Argyleshire, the distance is 160 miles ; but from the bottom of Loch Broom to the Firth of Dornoch, it is only twenty-four miles.

title: Tweed and Don; or, Recollections and reflections of an angler for the last fifty years ...
author: Locke, James.
snippet: We were also informed that there were capital takes of trout got in Loch Broom, in the neighbourhood, and if the angler extends his journey and make his way to Loch liannoch, a distance of some miles, Tigh- nalinn inn, at the head of it, will be found to be very fair quarters, and liberty to fish is soon obtained from Robertson of Struan.
